name: James GRAVATT, III, Appellant, v. BOROUGH OF LATROBE and Latrobe Board of Adjustment

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
parties: James GRAVATT, III, Appellant, v. BOROUGH OF LATROBE and Latrobe Board of Adjustment.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted, 44 Pa.Cmwlth. 475, 404 A.2d 729.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: William C. Stillwagon, Greensburg, for appellant.
Robert P. Lightcap, Lightcap, McDonald & Moore, Charles C. Mason, Jr., Latrobe, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
421 A.2d 210
James GRAVATT, III, Appellant, v. BOROUGH OF LATROBE and Latrobe Board of Adjustment.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 1, 1980.
Decided Nov. 3, 1980.
William C. Stillwagon, Greensburg, for appellant.
Robert P. Lightcap, Lightcap, McDonald & Moore, Charles C. Mason, Jr., Latrobe, for appellees.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
